column1: In people with badly damaged livers, proteins are not properly processed.
- Taking vitamins and medicines prescribed by your health care provider for low blood count, nerve problems, or nutritional problems from liver disease.
Salt in the diet may worsen fluid buildup and swelling in the liver.
General recommendations for people with severe liver disease include: - Eat large amounts of carbohydrate foods.
The increased carbohydrates and fat help prevent protein breakdown in the liver.
A person with a badly damaged liver may need to eat less protein.
